sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His arrest is viewed as part of a sweeping Kremlin crackdown on dissent and press freedom amid the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: He and the US government strongly deny the allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Wall Street Journal reporter is the first US correspondent since the Cold War to be detained in Russia on spying allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia's Federal Security Service arrested the 31-year-old in March and accused him of trying to obtain classified information about a Russian arms factory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The decision follows Monday's sentencing of Russian political activist and Kremlin critic Vladimir Karamurza to 25 years in jail on alleged acts of treason and denigrating the Russian military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Speaking outside the courthouse after Gershkovich's verdict, US Ambassador to Russia Lynne Tracy condemned the court's decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It comes as the three representatives made a joint appearance in front of TV cameras on the steps of a Moscow court on Monday, calling for the immediate release of Vladimir Karamurza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But Karamurza said his trial was politically motivated.

The UK defense ministry says there is a realistic possibility that Russia has reduced troop numbers and is decreasing offensive action around Donetsk city most likely to divert resources towards the Bakhmut sector where Russian forces are also stepping up their use of heavy artillery and airstrikes according to the commando of Ukraine's ground forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The U.K. Defense Ministry says the front line in Bakhmut largely follows the main railway line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is generally holding Russia's involvement from the south along the line of Korsunsko Street, the old main road west of the town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: According to the Institute for the Study of War, geolocated footage posted on the 16th of April shows that Wagner Group forces have advanced north of the Kostiantynivka-Chasev-Yar-Bakhmut route along the main railway in Bakhmut. The commander of Ukraine's ground forces said Ukrainian soldiers inflict significant losses on the enemy and significantly slow down its offensive. For both sides the exact sequencing of any major drawdown of their units around Bakhmut has become a critical question with Ukraine wanting to free up an offensive force while Russia likely aspires to regenerate an operational force. Wagner group leader Evgeny Prigozhin attempted to justify slow Wagner advances within Bakhmut likely in an attempt to pressure the Russian Ministry of Defense into providing Wagner with a consistent and adequate supply of artillery shells. The Institute for the Study of War says Prigozhin is seemingly regaining some favor with Russian President Vladimir Putin likely as a result of the Russian conventional military's inability to accomplish the tasks Putin had set up during the winter offensive in Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The European Union wants to build a shield against cyber attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Cyber threats have become more common, more powerful and more damaging and are now considered one of the main dangers for the EU. The defense system will be based on the prevention and detection of cyber attacks thanks to a pan-european cyber shield made up of public and private centers. This means entrusting part of the bloc's defense to private companies and forcing member states to cooperate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: No one can solve this alone. You cannot have sufficient resources ready because you don't know when you may be on an all-out cyber attack. We have seen very damaging attacks to, for instance, the Irish health system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have seen attacks where they go undiscovered for months, where there's been access to, for instance, foreign ministries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In addition, the E.U. will put in place an emergency mechanism capable of responding to cyberattacks as and when they happen. This would include a pool of experts and certified companies to neutralise the threat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Association for Digital Businesses believes that their collaboration is key.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There is no chance that the public sector will be able to do this themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They will never have access to the competences that we have. And this is really one area where we have totally overlapping interests to have a cyberspace and address hybrid threats in a common way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The proposals will cost 1.1 billion euros, of which two-thirds will come from the EU budget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The plans will now be reviewed by member states and the European Parliament before entering into force.
